page.title: 12Churches in the Creetings
page.content: CREETING ST. MARY CHURCH This building, mainly of flint, was founded in Norman times. The North doorway dates from this period and the porch from Tudor times. The font dates from 1462. The church was heavily restored in the 19th century. Church services vary each week. The present priest-in-charge is Canon Paul Davison, The Vicarage, Needham Market, Suffolk. WEST CREETING ST. PETER CHURCH The present building dates mainly from the 13th and 14th centuries, though there is a Norman door in the North wall. The church was restored in the 1800's. There is an interesting St. Christopher wall painting. The font is Perpendicular. Church services vary each week. The priest-in-charge is Rev. Brian Baker, The Rectory, Earl Stonham.
